result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany Nicole Adaway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable but ordered the surcharge waived. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management counseling.
Defendant to complete a parenting class if necessary.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tiffany Nicole Adaway in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Tiffany Nicole Adaway in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Defendant Tiffany Nicole Adaway in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE DALLET.
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS consecutive, straight time, in the House of Correction with credit for 29 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 10/23/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to complete a parenting class if necessary.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable but ordered the surcharge waived.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tiffany Nicole Adaway in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Defendant Tiffany Nicole Adaway in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case recalled.  State informed the Court there is a basis for a bail jumping charge and the defendant is the prime suspect in the arson case.  Court ordered sentencing adjourned.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for sentencing.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tiffany Nicole Adaway in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE DALLET.
Case set for sentencing.  State informed the Court the defendant is being investigated for an arson.  Court ordered defendant taken into custody and case passed while the state gets more information.

Defendant Tiffany Nicole Adaway in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect. Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tiffany Nicole Adaway in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tiffany Nicole Adaway in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-31-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dante G.   AND/OR    Demetria F.     AND/OR   their residences     AND/OR  their places of employment

No dangerous weapons

Defendant Tiffany Nicole Adaway in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-052

Defendant has lower number case pending in Branch 6.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court orders case adjourned for pre-trial conference in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms
